@sanga282 wrote:

Right well im really stumped on this its pissing me off it seems to be reading the axis instead of the position so this is what i have

onClipEvent (enterFrame) { if (this.hitTest(this._root.man)) { _x = _x+10; } } onClipEvent (enterFrame) { if (this.hitTest(this._root.man)) { _y = _y+10; } } onClipEvent (enterFrame) { if (this.hitTest(this._root.man)) { _y = _y-10; } } onClipEvent (enterFrame) { if (this.hitTest(this._root.man)) { _x = _x-10; } }
So this so far means that if its on the x axis it will go +10 as thats the first one because the second one is identical except telling it to change direction. I dont know what to change it to to read the position instead of the axis i have tried things like this

if (this.hitTest(this._root.man) and _x>_root.man) { _x = _x+10; } }
but to no avail i need it to do the following: when the object has an xvalue that is lower than the man and the man touches it, it moves ion a negative fashion and if the x value is greate and it touches the man it moves in a positive fashion. Same for the y but i cant do it. Any help?
